title: Option for specify network in voluntar-exit sub-command
body:
<!-- 
By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with the Code of Conduct, 
including treating everyone with respect:
https://github.com/Consensys/teku/blob/master/CODE-OF-CONDUCT.md

Not all sections will apply to all issue types.
-->

### Description
With Lighthouse BN, Teku VC cannot execute voluntary-exit with following error.
Lighthouse BN didn't provide `MAX_REQUEST_BLOCKS`. but, it seems similar with #7397 .
so, trying to find specify network name but, voluntary-exit sub-command didn't have it.

### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
- Teku validator client connected with Lighthouse BN.
- activate validator 
- try voluntary-exit with below docker command.
```sh
#!/bin/bash

docker run -it --name teku_validator_exit \
	--network host \
	-v <PATH_FOR_VALIDATOR_KEYS>:/root/vc/teku/validator_keys \
	consensys/teku:23.9.0 \
        voluntary-exit \
        --beacon-node-api-endpoint=<LIGHTHOUSE_BEACON_API_ENDPOINT> \
        --confirmation-enabled=false \
        --validator-keys="/root/vc/teku/validator_keys/<EXIT_VALIDATOR_KEYSTORE>:/root/vc/teku/validator_keys/<KEYSTORE_PASSWORD>" 
```
- run log
```sh
Loading configuration...
Failed to retrieve network spec from beacon node endpoint '<LIGHTHOUSE_BEACON_API_ENDPOINT>'.
Details: Missing value for spec constant 'MAX_REQUEST_BLOCKS'
```

Lighthouse BN didn't provide `MAX_REQUEST_BLOCKS`. so, trying to specify network. (refer to the #7397 )
but, there's no options for `network` in `voluntary-exit` sub-command.
```
Unknown options: '--network', 'goerli'

To display full help:
teku [COMMAND] --help
```

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]

**Frequency:** [How regularly does it occur?]

### Versions (Add all that apply)
* Software version: [`23.9.0`]
* Java version: [`java -version`]
* OS Name & Version: [`Ubuntu 22.04.3 LTS`]
* Docker Version: [`24.0.5, build ced0996`]
* Cloud VM, type, size: [Baremetal]
